args:
The prince and his friends seek assistance in
recapturing the Halidom, and turn to Seimei,
who refuses. But when the group encounters
the dragon of the Ox Wyrmclan, Gozu Tenno,
he agrees to help them secure Seimei's aid.
Yeee-haw! We got through that barrier\nin one dang piece!
Thank you for the helpâ€”though I still\ncan't believe something like this\nhappened to the Halidom.

There is so much we still don't understand.
What are our enemy's true goals?
What is this fell miasma they use?
And most crucially, what do we do now?
All good questions, Elly. Say, Kuzunoha?\nDo you think you can lead us to wherever\nSeimei is right now?
He seems well-informed about all of this,\nand I'm hoping he might see fit to help\nus out somehow.

Oh, he's smarter'n an owl in college all
right, but I can't be showin' ya where
he is or he'll get right steamed at me.
I'm his loyal servant, after all!

Also, I'm plumb tuckered out from lookin'
for Mukuroshu all morning, so the thought
of him givin' me the business is enough
to tuck my tail.
Heck, I ain't even had any vittles since\nI woke up this mornin'! Yessir, I done\ngoofed this up seven ways to Sunday...
Hunger, is it? Well, as luck would have it,\nI happen to have freshly made cookies\nhere for just such a situation.
You may have them...only if you\nshow us the way to Seimei.
Now that's a dilly of a deal, ma'am!\nY'all just follow me right that way!
You stupid foxâ€”they baited you with food\nso you would lead them straight to me!
It ain't like that, Lord Seimei! These folks\nare in a real mess of a pickle, and that's\nthe fox's honest!
Enough excusesâ€”I don't need any more\npets. Take them away and leave them\nunder a bridge somewhere.
Ha ha ha! Under a bridge...\nThat's rich, master. It ain't like they're\none'a yer shikigami!
(Uh oh. He's lookin' mighty mad...)\nI'm gonna go stand watch byeeee!
Please don't blame her. We tricked her\ninto taking us here because we needed\nto talk to you.
You've been chasing after Doman, right?\nIn that case, I was thinking we should\ncombine our might and fight him togeâ€”
I gain nothing by joining hands with fools.
You churl! Wyrmclan leader or no,\nI shall not permit any to so insult\nHis Highness!

Since when is the truth an insult?
Your prince welcomed the enemy into his
inner sanctum with smiles and open arms.
Such is the very definition of an idiot.

As we speak, your castle is awash in
deadly miasma. You'd have been dead
without my interference, and you will be
dead if you attempt to return there now.
You are naught but a gaggle of idiots,\nand I gain nothing by joining you.
You're right that Doman tricked us,\nbut that doesn't change the fact that\nyou're still trying to stop him.
He's trying to do something to the\nHalidom, and we have to make sure\nhe doesn't succeed.

Is there residual miasma in your ears,
or do I perhaps need to learn another
language that you better understand?
Go away. I will not help you.
Now THAT's a guy who don't want\nno part'a what we're sellin'.
I knowâ€”but without him, I don't even\nknow how to begin retaking the Halidom.
Then we'll just have to convince him!\nWe can start by setting up shop in that\nnearby village andâ€”
That scream! We must go help!
A HUMONGOUS dragon that's headed\nstraight for us, ya mean!
Stay frosty, everybodyâ€”that there ain't\nno ordinary dragon. Look at the eyes...
Hey! Big fella! Whatcha botherin'\nall the locals for, eh?
Ha! That's the oldest tale in the book!\nYa want... Wait, what?
Fried tofu. Pressed soy? It's delicious.\nWhere can I make such a purchase?
And why, exactly, did you bring these\npeople back with you, Gozu Tenno?
They were kind enough to take me\nshopping, so I wanted to thank them.

Er, sorry about this...again.
Still, imagine our surprise when we ran
into one of the Great Twelve out shopping
for his dinner!
We were pretty worried at first, what with\nthe hugeness and the scary face and all\nthat, but turns out he's YOUR pactwyrm!
Cleo, how does this stick make fire?
You rub it with a stone to create friction,\nwhich then sparks the flame.
Heh... Most convenient. I would\nquite like to take this back to Hinomoto.
I turn my back for one minute and\nsuddenly they're best friends? Bah!
Guess ya ain't used to how we do things\nhere in Alberiaâ€”but don't worry, we filled\nyer dragon friend in on all of it.

Also, I dunno why he's doing food runs
for ya, but folks what can't do their own
grocery shoppin' tend to have a rough
go of it in our little corner of the world.
What do you say, Seimei?\nLet's all stop Doman together.
Surely it would make your life easier\nif you traveled with people who know\nboth Alberia and the Halidom, right?
We won'tâ€”you can count on it!

Then let me introduce myself properly:
I am Gozu Tenno. Wyrm of the Ox and
pactbound to Lord Seimei. Pleased to
make your acquaintance.
I'm tickled pinker'n a freshly shorn sheep\nthat we'll be workin' together! Yeee-haw!
Hey, that's the thing Kuzunoha said\nwhen she introduced herself, right?\nWhat the heck does it even mean?

An onmyoji is an official in Hinomoto's
civil service. They fulfill the role of guide,
and also support the land through
steadfast divination and prayer.
We also solve mysteries and break curses!\nYessir, anything what smells fishy y'all can\njust leave to us onmyoji!
Fool and baseless guarantees like that are\nexactly why the people of Hinomoto think\nthey can call me for any odd job they have.
Still, at least this mission will prevent\nme from having to do that inane fortune-\nspreading event. That's something.
You went and ASKED for this mission!
Doman is merely a piece of the puzzle.\nI'm actually after the organization he\nworks forâ€”a group called the Mukuroshu.
Are they the ones who put him up\nto attacking the Halidom?

Yes. It seems your castle is influenced by
a nearby dragon-vein spring, which has
caused mana of the highest purity to well
up inside of it for hundreds of years.

It is the perfect environment for them
to create the Underworld Key, which
will in turn allow them to open the gate
to the Realm of the Dead.
But if they do that, that world and our own\nmight very well merge together, putting\neveryone who lives here at risk!
Why would they do such a thing?

They'll do anything if it means defeating the
Hinomotoan shogunate and overthrowing
its current leadership. No matter the risk
to civilian life.
So the Mukuroshu are a revolutionary\ngroup of sorts?

Don't give them that much credit.
They're merely a motley mishmash of
anti-government dissidents and fools
obsessed with that other world.
My, but this is an impressive barrier.\nThis must have certainly slowed you\ndown, Doman.
After I went to all the trouble of\npreparing a letter from the shogunate\nand guiding you here, too.
And I thank you for your assistance.\nWith that letter, I was easily able to\nmislead the lord of the castle.
Although I suppose ï¼‚misleadï¼‚ isn't\naccurate, seeing as how this letter\nis the real thing. Heh heh heh...
So long as you're happy. Now then, I must\nbe off; I've another mission to fulfill.
My mission as one of the leaders\nof the Twelve Wyrmclans, that is.
